Line 100: Line 100:
In June 2009 Canonical created the ''One Hundred Paper Cuts'' project, hiring developers to fix minor accessibility issues that are annoyances to Ubuntu users.<ref>https://launchpad.net/hundredpapercuts</ref>
In June 2009 Canonical created the ''One Hundred Paper Cuts'' project, hiring developers to fix minor accessibility issues that are annoyances to Ubuntu users.<ref>https://launchpad.net/hundredpapercuts</ref>
â
The desktop installation of Ubuntu 9.10 is expected to include, among other programs, GIMP 2.6<ref>https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/karmic/i386/gimp</ref>, GNOME 2.28, [[Mozilla Firefox 3.5]], OpenOffice.org 3.1<ref>https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/karmic/i386/openoffice.org</ref>, Linux 2.6.31, X.Org 7.5<ref>https://launchpad.net/~xorg-edgers/+archive/ppa</ref> and [[Empathy (software)|Empathy Instant Messenger]] instead of Pidgin<ref>https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/karmic/i386/empathy</ref><ref>http://www.ubuntu.com/testing/karmic/alpha3</ref>. [[ext4]] will be the default filesystem and [[Ubuntu One]], Canonical's new online storage system, will be installed by default.
+
The desktop installation of Ubuntu 9.10 is expected to include, among other programs, GIMP 2.6<ref>https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/karmic/i386/gimp</ref>, GNOME 2.28, [[Mozilla Firefox 3.5]], OpenOffice.org 3.1<ref>https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/karmic/i386/openoffice.org</ref>, Linux 2.6.31, X.Org 7.5<ref>https://launchpad.net/~xorg-edgers/+archive/ppa</ref> and [[Empathy (software)|Empathy Instant Messenger]] instead of Pidgin<ref>https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/karmic/i386/empathy</ref><ref>http://www.ubuntu.com/testing/karmic/alpha3</ref>. [[ext4]] will be the default filesystem and [[Ubuntu One]], Canonical's new online storage system, will be installed by default.{{fact}}
